vision.notes: Winged forms possess compound eyes and ocelli (simple eyes). Wingless forms lack eyes and ocelli.

chemoreception.notes: Inferred presence due to habitat and feeding behavior. Likely important for finding food and mates under bark, in dry wood, or in leaf litter. Nine-segmented beaded antennae are present.

mechanoreception.notes: Inferred presence due to the need to navigate in dark environments and detect vibrations.
